case_title: MUHAMMAD NAWAZ Und 3 Other vs MUHAMMAD IKHLAQ Etc

legal_points.temporary_vs_permanent_lambardar: The law does not recognize the concepts of 'temporary lambardar' and 'permanent lambardar'.

rules_involved.rule_17: Deals with first appointments and qualifications required for lambardars.
rules_involved.rule_19: Deals with succession of lambardars based on estate ownership (government-owned vs privately-owned).
rules_involved.rule_21: Envisages special contingencies unrelated to normal circumstances.

legal_points.succession_criteria: Rule 19(2) applies to estates owned chiefly by private individuals, requiring hereditary claims under primogeniture.

facts_of_case.ownership_change: Village transitioned from government-owned to privately-owned before Sanaullah's death in 1987.
facts_of_case.dispute: Deputy Commissioner and Commissioner incorrectly considered Sanaullah as 'temporary lambardar'.

judgment_summary.revision_petition_accepted: Naseer Ahmad appointed as lambardar succeeding Sanaullah.
other_petitions_disposed: R.O.R. No. 1127 of 1990: MUHAMMAD NAWAZ vs MUHAMMAD IKHLAQ Etc
R.O.R No. 1462 of 1991: MUHAMMAD AKHLAQ vs MUHAMMAD NAWAZ

key_decision: Succession governed by Rule 19(2) and primogeniture; Naseer Ahmad succeeds Sanaullah.
